H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7649.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H7267.def: = state in which the body of humans and animals shakes involuntarily, ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, excitement, or other emotions

H6731.def: = flower that appears with the new growth on trees and shrubs before they produce their fruit

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H1272.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H6491.def: literally: to open (someone else's) eyes; hence: = causative action by which deities give humans the ability to see things that they were not able to see before

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H2889.def: = state in which an object is free from dirt, contamination and everything else that is not supposed to be present

H2931.def: = state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H2782.def: literally: to sharpen one's tongue; hence: = action by which  humans or animals show aggression to someone else with sounds or in speech

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H2320.def: = period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H2308.def: = process by which objects stop existing in this world

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H7521.def: = state in which an animal or its meat is acceptable to God as sacrifice

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7916.def: = state in which animals or objects have been made available to be of service or use to others for a limited amount of time and in return for payment

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H2498.def: = process by which an object appears in a certain location

H3127.def: = young branch growing from the stump or stem of a tree or plant

H2308.def: = process by which objects stop existing in this world

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H8328.def: = a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well-being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind

H2204.def: = state in which humans are advanced in age, ≈ and the body is no longer able to function as before

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1503.def: = the main body of a tree, which is either the part that remains in the earth after the stem or trunk is cut off, or a branch that is planted with the intention that it develops new roots; ≈ symbol of something apparently dead that has the potential for renewed life

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H7381.def: = a distinctive smell, which can be perceived as either pleasant or unpleasant; ≈ sometimes associated with the attitude a certain smell evokes in those who perceive it

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H5194.def: = vegetation, ◄ intentionally sown or planted by humans

4.gl: scent of water > presence of water

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H2522.def: = process by which humans run out of physical strength

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H1478.def: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death

H335.def: = referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H2717.def: = process by which a body of water or place that was formerly covered with moisture dries up, ◄ as a result of evaporation or draining; ► in the case of land, if this condition persists, sedentary life will become impossible

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H7901.def: = state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H1115.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H6974.def: = process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H6845.def: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H3176.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H2487.def: = set of inanimate objects that belong together

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H3700.def: = state/process by which humans, deities, or animals experience a strong desire to see an object or perform an event

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H6806.def: = action by which humans put one foot before the other in order to move forward; ≈ often used figuratively to denote someone's journey through life

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H2856.def: = to put a seal on a written document; ► in order to confirm that the document is authentic and to keep unauthorized readers from having access to it; ≈ associated with both authenticity and secrecy

H6872.def: = small container ◄ made of cloth; ► used to transport money, pack aromatic spices in order to put it between clothes, etc .; ≈ associated with possessions and treasures

H2950.def: = to cover a surface with {L:whitewash<SDBH:תָּפֵל>} ► to make it white and cover ugly rough surfaces; ≈ often associated with efforts to make something appear different from what it actually is

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

2.gl: to seal (someone's) sins in a bag > to forgive (someone's sins)

H199.def: = marker indicating that the information that follows is in contrast with what has preceded

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H5034.def: = process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H6275.def: = process by which rocks move spontaneously from one place to another

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H5599.def: = a strong and fast flowing stream of water

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H6819.def: literally: to be small; hence: = state in which humans are still relatively young

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H3510.def: = state in which humans are physically wounded

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H56.def: = to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it
